title: Calling Peaks from Replicated ChIP Data
summary: In replicated ChIP-Seq datasets there are a few different ways to call peaks. We go through a few options for how to call peaks, explaining the differences between them and the strengths and weaknesses of each

title: Annotating probes with promoters
summary: One common functional annotation to a set of probes is to identify those which are in promoters.  Doing this can be tricky and there are different approaches depending on what you want to do with the results, and your exact definition of a promoter

title: Pairwise RNA-Seq differential expression
summary: A simple differential expression analysis between two conditions with no confounding factors. The most straight forward type of RNA-Seq analysis.  Uses DESeq2 and Intensity difference tests.
